snippet: A soldier who was absent without leave from a fort in Kentucky and plotted to kill other soldiers near Fort Hood remained defiant on Friday as he was sentenced to life in prison, vowing never to end what he considered his holy war.
abstract: Pfc Naser Jason Abdo, soldier who was absent without leave from a Kentucky fort and plotted to kill other soldiers near Fort Hood, is sentenced to life in prison.
lead_paragraph: A soldier who was absent without leave from a fort in Kentucky and plotted to kill other soldiers near Fort Hood remained defiant on Friday as he was sentenced to life in prison, vowing never to end what he considered his holy war.
